text: I've turned off event_processing for this and the code isn't overly heavy (although not fully profiled).  Using market.context['processed'] made it run in a fraction of the time i.e. 30 minutes versus 8-9 hours or so.

text: what are you doing in pandas? / my understanding is that you are only placing one bet so surely you just need to do the dirty pandas stuff once per market/strategy?

text: Okay, that does make a bit of sense.  At the start of the script I read in the event_id, time and distance to a pandas df, and then I check the df to get the distance when it opens a new market.  At some point I have pushed that down the processing order until it got to the point where I had it checking it as it processed each runner.  If I bump it up so that it is only checking once per market, I'm certain that would make this run quicker.  Only one way to find out.

elements.text: Okay, that does make a bit of sense.  At the start of the script I read in the event_id, time and distance to a pandas df, and then I check the df to get the distance when it opens a new market.  At some point I have pushed that down the processing order until it got to the point where I had it checking it as it processed each runner.  If I bump it up so that it is only checking once per market, I'm certain that would make this run quicker.  Only one way to find out.
